intro: Zephyranthes concinna, commonly known as the fairy lantern or night lily, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with warm, humid climates. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming at night. It has strap-like, grassy leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Zephyranthes concinna is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soil and partial shade.
